    • chat

      public static String chat(String s)

    • format

      public static String format(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String message, String prefix)

    • emptyList

      public static List<String> emptyList()

    • getMenuByClassName

      public static Menu getMenuByClassName(String menuPackage, String className, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Gets a menu by its class name. The menu must be in the menu package. If the menu is not found, it will return null.
      Parameter:
      menuPackage - The package of the menu
      className - The name of the class
      player - The player to open the menu for
      Gibt zurück:
      The menu

    • openConfirmationMenu

      public static void openConfirmationMenu(String reason, String menuToOpenAfter, String menuPackage, Method methodToExecuteAfter, Object objectToInvokeOn, List<Object> methodArgs, List<Class<? extends Exception>> exceptionsToCatch, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Opens a confirmation menu for the player to confirm an action. If the player confirms the action, the methodToExecuteAfter will be executed. If the player cancels the action, the menuToOpenAfter will be opened.
      Parameter:
      reason - The reason for the confirmation
      menuToOpenAfter - The menu to open after the confirmation
      menuPackage - The package of the menu
      methodToExecuteAfter - The method to execute after the confirmation
      objectToInvokeOn - The object to invoke the method on
      methodArgs - The arguments for the method
      exceptionsToCatch - The exceptions to catch
      player - The player to open the menu for

    • createSkull

      public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack createSkull(String headValue, String name, boolean isTexture)

      Creates a player skull item with a custom head texture or player name.

      
 ItemStack skull = Utils.createSkull("textureStringOrPlayerName", "Display Name", true);
      Parameter:
      headValue - the head texture string or player name
      name - the display name for the skull item
      isTexture - true if headValue is a texture string, false if it is a player name
      Gibt zurück:
      the created ItemStack representing the skull

    • applyItemStackToProfile

      @NotNull public static @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack applyItemStackToProfile(String headValue, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack head, org.bukkit.inventory.meta.SkullMeta meta)

    • createSkull

      public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack createSkull(Head headTexture, String name)
      Creates a skull with a head texture and a name from a Head Object.
      This method can only handle values from Head
      Parameter:
      headTexture - Element from the Head Enum with Head String Values
      name - The name of the skull
      Gibt zurück:
      The skull

    • getResource

      @Nullable public static @Nullable InputStream getResource(@NotNull @NotNull String filename)
      Gets a resource from the classloader. If the resource is not found, it will return null.
      Parameter:
      filename - The name of the resource
      Gibt zurück:
      The InputStream of the resource or null if not found

    • saveResource

      public static void saveResource(File configFolder, @NotNull @NotNull String resourcePath, boolean replace)
      Save a resource from the classloader to a file. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.
      Parameter:
      configFolder - The folder where the resource should be saved
      resourcePath - The path of the resource
      replace - If true, the file will be overwritten if it already exists

    • zipFiles

      public static void zipFiles(File[] files, String zipFile, File baseDir) throws IOException
      Zips multiple files into a single zip file.
      Parameter:
      files - The files to zip
      zipFile - The name of the zip file to create
      Löst aus:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • unzipFiles

      public static void unzipFiles(String zipFilePath, String destDir, boolean replace)
      Unzips a zip file to a specified directory.
      Parameter:
      zipFilePath - The path to the zip file
      destDir - The destination directory where the files will be unzipped
      replace - If true, existing files will be replaced
